vectorData.altText: 4. The head is ________ to the body.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.

the anatomical position: erect posture, feet together, eyes forward, palms forward
terms are usually* relative 
anterior in front of vs. posterior behind
as compared to     :
ventral toward the belly vs. dorsal toward the back
superior above vs. inferior below
cranial / cephalic toward the head vs. caudal toward the tail (i.e. the coccyx in humans)
medial toward the midline vs. lateral away from the midline
median* is an absolute term
proximal toward the beginning vs. distal toward the end re. limbs; also tubular structure such as the digestive and genitourinary system
superficial toward the surface vs. deep away from the surface
i.e. compare the positions of two structures
these pairs of terms are usually equivalent in the case of humans; there are some exceptions in neuroanatomy
think of the dorsal and ventral fins of a shark or fish; in this case, the terms are not synonymous with anterior and posterior, but with superior and inferior
it does not compare the position of one structure relative to that of another structure; it tells you that the one structure is in the midline of the body or limb
Thats right! The head is superior to the body.
